>
>hey...
>
>thanks for the respo=
nse. my questions are pretty basic, so bear with me!
>
>1) is it possible t=
o provide a list of domains/urls that the app can crawl
>through, thus crea=
ting a basic domain/pool of content. ie, is it possible
>for us to "feed" t=
he urls of the various college registrar sites to the
app,
>and have it the=
n return/save the information to an internal file, or series
>of files.

Ye=
s. 

>
>2) is it possible to configure the app to only return pages from a =
given
url
>that have certain information/tags/elements, or is that better h=
andled by
>the parser/reader function?

A custom module can be plugged into=
 the processing chain that looks for this
type of information. But it would=
 then also require a custom writer module
to take advantage of the informat=
ion.

>
>3) once we have the returned information, how difficult/easy is it=
 to
>write/create a reader? if we are looking to parse multiple schools, wo=
uld
it
>make sense to write a separate reader for each school that would ha=
ve been
>returned from the crawling app?

It occurs to me that you _might_ =
be best off not using the standard ARC
writer that comes with Heritrix. Rat=
her implement your own writer that
examines the content and makes informed =
decisions about what to write to
disk. That writer could then write the fil=
es to disk any way you like. In
fact you could have it simply extract what =
data you are interested in and
only write that piece of information. For in=
formation about writing custom
modules refer to the developers manual on ou=
r website. It and the user
manual are quite comprehensive and should give y=
ou a clear idea of
Heritrix's potential.

>
>4) are there reasonably well d=
ocumented readers for us to review? it would
>help greatly to be able to ru=
n a crawling app, and then pass the reader
over
>the returned information..=
. this would allow a way to see how the overall
>apps actually function..

=
I'm unsure of the status of existing readers. But if you opt for the above
=
idea you wouldn't need to bother with ARC files.

>another question...
>
>c=
an the heritrix app be setup/configured to access sites that require a
>use=
r/passwd in a manner similar to what i can do with a perl (LWP) app...??

Y=
es, credentials can be supplied for certain types of logins. This is
covere=
d in the user manual.

>
>thanks for your time/patience...

No problem.
